context.p: A JIRA Template represents a specific combination of JIRA data for a Program. JIRA Templates are used when creating a booking to create a JIRA issue with relevant data.
NOTE: This feature is only available to users with granted privileges
Create a new JIRA Template for an existing Program within the PDU OSS Deployment Tracking Tool.

info.p: Click the Programs link in the navigation bar.
Click the View button on an existing Program in the table.
Click the Add JIRA Template button.
Enter the details as shown below.
NOTE: Any restrictions on the fields are outlined.

ul.li: JIRA Board: JIRA Board which data will be sent to.
JIRA Issue Type: Type of JIRA Issue e.g. 'Task', 'Story'.
Project: Name of Project which the Booking belongs to.
Components: Components associated with the Booking.
Custom Fields: Custom Fields which can be defined by the user e.g. Team Name.

info.p: Click the Save button, the JIRA Template will be added to the Program, and the user will be redirected back to the view page for the Program with the new JIRA Template added.
NOTE: JIRA Templates will not save if any fields are invalid (invalid fields are highlighted in red).

result.p: A New JIRA Template is created in the PDU OSS Deployment Tracking Tool.
